metadata.title: CVE-2019-11471 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
libheif 1.4.0 has a use-after-free inheif::HeifContext::Image::set_alpha_channel in heif_context.h becauseheif_context.cc mishandles references to non-existing alpha images.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heif-gdk-pixbuf - 1.4.0-2
heif-thumbnailer - 1.4.0-2
libheif-examples - 1.4.0-2
libheif1 - 1.4.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libheif package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.0-2').
